de.polygonal.ds.mem.MemoryManager

type
class
Manages 'alchemy memory'.
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2009/03/14/a-little-alchemy-in-hx3ds/.

Static Variables

BLOCK_SIZE_BYTES : Int

The minimum block size for allocating additional memory on the fly. The default value (which is also the minimum) is 1024 bytes or 1 KiB. Changing this value has no effect after memory has been allocated.

MEMORY_LIMIT_BYTES : Int

The total number bytes that the user is allowed to allocate (1 MiB equals 1.048.576 bytes). This should be used as a safe upper limit for detecting memory leaks during development. The default value is 64 MiB.

RAW_BYTES : Int

A reserved, fixed portion of bytes at the beginning of the byte array which can be used as a temporary buffer or for doing math tricks. Changing this value has no effect after memory has been allocated.

RESERVE_BYTES : Int

The total number of bytes to preallocate prior to the first call to malloc(). Default is zero bytes.

bytesFree(__bytesFree,null) : Int

The total number of free bytes.

bytesTotal(__bytesTotal,null) : Int

The total number of allocated bytes.

bytesUsed(__bytesUsed,null) : Int

The total number of used bytes.

Static Methods

dealloc(access : MemoryAccess) : Void

Deallocates the memory used by access.

defrag() : Void

Performs a full defragmentation of the allocated memory.

draw(g : flash.display.Graphics, bounds : flash.geom.Rectangle) : Void

Draws a visual representation of the memory manager.

free() : Void

Releases all allocated memory and nullifies references so all used resources can be garbage collected.

malloc(access : MemoryAccess, numBytes : Int) : Void

Allocates and assigns numBytes to access.

pack() : Void

Releases unused memory.

realloc(access : MemoryAccess, numBytes : Int) : Void

Resizes access to match numBytes.

toString() : String
